title: Making an impact through authenticity and curiosity | Ami Vora (CPO at Faire, ex-WhatsApp, FB, IG)
key_insights: Respond to disagreements with curiosity rather than defensiveness - say 'fascinating, tell me more' to unlock learning opportunities
Execution beats strategy every time - customers care about the product in their hands, not your five-year plan
Use metaphors and analogies to create shared narratives that align teams without micromanaging decisions
Avoid 'toddler soccer' by giving teams different goals that ladder up to the main company metric
Product reviews should establish principles for future decisions, not just make individual choices
As you get more senior, you only see unsolvable problems - leadership is choosing the least bad option
Follow emotional instincts about where you feel 'at home' rather than spreadsheet analysis for career decisions
Bring recommendations, not just data, to leadership meetings - executives have 'dinosaur brains' and can only hold three facts
topics_discussed: Handling disagreements with curiosity and authenticity
The dinosaur brain concept for executive communication
Hill climb metaphor for strategic transitions
Using metaphors to align product teams
Face-to-face communication as WhatsApp's product philosophy
Goal setting to avoid team conflicts
Challenges of being a woman in tech leadership
memorable_quotes: I really enjoy being right and then it turns out in the working world, that did not serve me so great. The hard part is sublimating your ego a little bit and saying it's more important to get to the outcome than to be right.
If we all agree that the feeling of something should be, I'm sitting in Dolores Park with my friends on a sunny Saturday, then people will just naturally build something that feels more consistent.
You can either have more energy or less ambition.
frameworks_mentioned: Hill climb metaphor (local vs global optimum)
Dinosaur brain concept for executive communication
Manager owns context, I own recommendation
recommended_for: Engineering managers transitioning to product leadership
Women in tech seeking leadership guidance
Anyone interested in authentic leadership approaches
summary: Ami Vora shares her authentic journey from Facebook temp to CPO at Faire, emphasizing curiosity-driven leadership, execution over strategy, and using metaphors to align teams. The conversation focuses on practical frameworks for product leadership while addressing the messy realities of senior leadership roles.
